title: Momentum - Change in velocity inelastic collision

content.prompt: Which of the following statements correctly describes the change in momentum of the cart between times t=t1 and t=t2 ?

choices.label: The momentum of the cart decreases because the momentum of the cart is always conserved.
The momentum of the cart decreases because there is a net external force on the cart.
The momentum of the cart remains the same because momentum is always conserved.
The momentum of the cart remains the same because the box only had vertical momentum originally.

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
